description: Unitary harmonic numbers (those for which the unitary harmonic mean is an integer).
comments: Let d(n) and sigma(n) be number of and sum of unitary divisors of n; then the unitary harmonic mean of the unitary divisors is H(n)=n*d(n)/sigma(n). - _Emeric Deutsch_, Dec 22 2004A103340(a(n)) = 1; A103339(a(n)) = A006087(n). [_Reinhard Zumkeller_, Mar 17 2012]
references: P. Hagis, Jr. and G. Lord, Unitary harmonic numbers, Proc. Amer. Math. Soc., 51 (1975), 1-7.
N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
links: Donovan Johnson, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..290 (terms < 10^12)
mathematica: ud[n_] := 2^PrimeNu[n]; usigma[n_] := Sum[ If[ GCD[d, n/d] == 1, d, 0], {d, Divisors[n]}]; uhm[n_] := n*ud[n]/usigma[n]; Reap[ Do[ If[ IntegerQ[uhm[n]], Print[n]; Sow[n]], {n, 1, 10^6}]][[2, 1]] (* _Jean-FranÃ§ois Alcover_, May 16 2013 *)
prog: (Haskell)a006086 n = a006086_list !! (n-1)a006086_list = filter ((== 1) . a103340) [1..]-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Mar 17 2012
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
